title: Shoulder to Shoulder 1974
description:
A BBC series that dramatizes how women fought for and won the right to vote in England. It covers the period from the 1890s to the end of World War I, and essentially follows the suffrage movement as it was influenced by Richard Pankhurst, a Manchester barrister and a believer in women's rights, and as it was championed by his wife, Emmeline, and their daughters, Christabel and Sylvia. The six-part drama originally aired on the BBC then on `Masterpiece Theatre' in the US.

Sian Phillips as Emmeline Pankhurst
  
Patricia Quinn as Christabel Pankhurst
  
Angela Down as Sylvia Pankurst
  
Georgia Brown as Annie Kenney
  
Michael Gough as Dr. Richard PankhurstFormat 


If you've just seen the movie Suffragette (2015) this covers the history in a bit more detail.

Never released on DVD so these are copies of a previous broadcast recording. 

Video quality is low but sound fine
